result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin E Eith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01/08/2016 @ 1:15pm, Br-38

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restitition is set at 0.
- No contact with firearms. 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crimes of domesti violence.

- Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/ Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; pending a review on 01-08-16 at 1:15pm, Br-38

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin E Eith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Agent Bober, defendant has been REVOKED effective 11-10-2015.  Review is CANCELLED.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for jury trial today.  Parties have resolved case.  
As to counts 1 and 2:  Based on negotiations, the court will order counts dismissed and read in for sentencing.
As to count 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 11 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court, defendant Benjamin E Eith not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-5-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  All available discovery was provided to defense counsel  by the State.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  

Victim Biljana J-F., appeared to requested modification of the no contact order.  Court denied request to modify the no contact order.  

Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-5-2015 at 8:30 am.   All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Biljana J-F., no firearms, no drugs or alcohol and cooperate fully with Justice Point Supervision.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Benjamin E Eith in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters pleas of Not Guilty on Misdemeanor Counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
